Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2013 11:02AM LD43 wrote: Hi; I am 53 and just had a mammo/US on 12/19 for a palpable lump in L breast.  I have lots of microcalcifications in both breasts, but the radiologist wasn't that concerned about the pattern of them.  However, the lump was reported as:  "Hypoechoic region with irregular margins that corresponds to the palpable abnormality".  Signed out as BIRADS 4.   Also mentioned visible lymph nodes in axillary region. Already talked to breast surgeon who reviewed films with Radiologist on Friday.  They want to do a needle localization and open biopsy.  Hopefully I will hear from his RN on 12/23.  Surgeon is working 12/26 and 12/27, so I am hoping we can schedule it on one of those days.   Just wanted to touch base with anyone having a similar report, and wondering how things turned out! Thanks!
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy Appointment foreveryours foreveryours

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2013 02:29PM LD43 wrote: Thanks everyone for the kind words!  I am not 100% sure exactly why they want to go straight to open biopsy -- the radiologist recommended it.  He seemed to want pathology to have the whole thing.  So, technically I guess, I will be having a lumpectomy/biopsy.   The surgeon said he will take the whole lump out.   We'll see!
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy Appointment foreveryours foreveryours
